title: Forza Motorsport Content Updates Are Coming To An End
description: Developer Turn 10 Studios has announced that it is ending development of new content for Forza Motorsport. In a blog update, the studio confirmed that there will be no "new cars, tracks, features, or regular bug fixes" for the game, but it will continue to support Forza Motorsport by keeping the servers online. "As our team shifts its focus toward delivering the best possible experience with Forza Horizon 6 in 2026, we do not plan to introduce new cars, tracks, features, or regular bug fixes for Forza Motorsport," Turn 10 Studios wrote. "However, we will continue supporting the game by keeping online servers active, hosting special events and competitions, and reintroducing previously released Featured Tours and reward cars every month, until all content is available for you to enjoy anytime." First released in 2023, Forza Motorsport was designed to be a fresh start for Microsoft's sim-racing series, with ambitious plans to support it as a live-service game for years. Back in July, Turn 10 Studios was hit with massive layoffs, and players noticed that new content for the game had begun to slow down. In August, Turn 10 said that it still planned to support Forza Motorsport with several events, but these quickly dried up toward the end of 2025. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Xbox December Update Adds Store Tab To Xbox Mobile And Headset Improvements
description: Xbox's December update is here, and this time it's focused on your off-console experience. The update brings new store functionality to the Xbox mobile app, as well as adding Bluetooth Low Energy (LE) Audio support to the Xbox Wireless Headset, improving battery life and audio quality with certain Windows 11 devices. In April, Microsoft added the ability to purchase games and subscribe to Game Pass directly from the Xbox app. Now, making it even easier to buy games from your phone, the app is getting a store tab for quicker browsing. The update also adds your Wishlist to the app, as well as allowing you to search for add-ons directly in the app. The update is rolling out now across iOS and Android devices. Microsoft is also rolling out a firmware update for the Xbox Wireless Headset that'll add support for Bluetooth LE Audio, a Windows 11 feature that not only improves battery life, but also boosts audio quality. The update boasts lower latency, longer battery life, and super wideband stereo audio for voice chat. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Diablo 4's Goblin Greedings Lets You Beat Up Goblins For More Loot
description: It's not an easy life for Sanctuary's citizens in Diablo 4, but players can make things a little brighter in the upcoming holiday event Goblin Greedings. Starting on December 18, players will be to put presents under their tree--so to speak--by clobbering creatures for loot and bringing a little hope back to Estuar. To claim their prizes, players will have to face hordes of Treasure Goblins and earn their place on the March of the Goblins reputation board. There are multiple tiers to unlock, and players can claim their prizes between each one by visiting the Goblin Square in Kyovashad. Once players complete the final tier, they will be given a Resplendent Spark. That final tier is repeatable, and the quality of the loot dropped by enemies will increase with each tier. However, players will only have until January 6, 2026 to work their way through and claim as much treasure as they can. Returning Grim Favors during Goblin Greedings will also give players an additional cache for Gift of the Tree. All they need to do to claim it is to select a cache, which will reveal the treasure they've been given by the Gift of the Tree. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Fallout Season 2, Episode 1 Easter Eggs Include A “Damn Fine” Twin Peaks Reference
description: SPOILERS for Fallout Season 2 Episode 1: The Man Who Knew to follow: Fallout finally returns with Season 2, and with it comes an exciting new setting, taking the show from the sunny shores of Los Angeles to the sweltering heat of the Mojave Wasteland. While this setting hails from the beloved classic Fallout: New Vegas, it provides new opportunities to expand on the world of Fallout with an entirely fresh perspective. Even though we’re only one episode in, there are plenty of easter eggs and references for eagle-eyed viewers and die hard fans to catch. Here’s a look at some of the nods we noticed in the show’s introduction to the Mojave Wasteland. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Fallout Season 2 Episode 1 Kicked Off With A Bang, Literally
description: SPOILERS for Fallout Season 2 Episode 1: The Man Who Knew to follow: The last time we saw Lucy MacLean (Ella Purnell), The Ghoul aka Cooper Howard (Walton Goggins), and beloved pup CX404, their situation looked dire. Lucy had learned her father Hank (Kyle MacLachlan) was responsible for the destruction of Shady Sands, The Brotherhood of Steel was in a heated battle with the New California Republic over control of Griffith Observatory, and Cooper realized that Hank held the answers to the whereabouts of his family. While Hank slipped out in the ensuing chaos and headed to New Vegas, Lucy decided to join Cooper in his quest for answers, which led them into unknown and dangerous territory. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: TMNT Trilogy 4K Limited Edition Is Now Available - Save $42 On Launch Day
description: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Trilogy: Limited Edition (4K Blu-ray) $58 (was $100) | Available Now See at Amazon The highly anticipated 4K restorations of the first three Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles movies are available now. TMNT Trilogy Limited Edition features 4K Blu-ray editions of the early '90s live-action movies for $58 (was $100). The 4K restorations are accompanied by new bonus features and archival content as well as multiple posters, a booklet with new commentary, trading cards, and more collectibles. Arrow Video's limited editions are actually limited, so once TMNT Trilogy sells out, any future printings won't include the collectibles. If you need a holiday gift for a TMNT fan, Amazon's store page says Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Trilogy will arrive with a few days to spare (as of December 16). The TMNT Trilogy is also available on 1080p Blu-ray, but it's actually more expensive than the 4K Blu-ray edition at the moment. Fans can also get the newly restocked TMNT: Mutant Mayhem 4K Steelbook Edition for $25.89 and the recently released TMNT: The Last Ronin Graphic Novel Box Set for $60.90 (was $95). Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Get 25 PC Games For $64 With This New Fanatical Deal
description: Fanatical is closing 2025 out with a new build-your-own bundle deal, the Best of Platinum Collection. This deal offers a selection of various acclaimed PC games featured in the various Platinum Collection bundles throughout 2025, giving you a chance to pick up some excellent games for cheap. Like Fanatical's other build your own bundle promotions, you can pick as many games from the list as you'd like, and the more games you buy, the more you save. To start, you can pick up to four games for $3.33 each. At five or more games, you'll pay $3 per item. Grab 10 or more games, and you'll pay just $2.90 per game, and if you want the full 22-game bundle, it'll run you $63.78, a $547.75 value--not too shabby for literally thousands of hours of entertainment. See bundle at Fanatical One of the items you can pick, the SteamWorld Classic Bundle, comes with four games: SteamWorld Dig, SteamWorld Dig 2, SteamWorld Heist, and SteamWorld Quest: Hand of Gilgamech. So, really, if you decide to add this to the Best of Platinum Collection, it could be a total of 25 games. The list of possible games also includes the strategy game SteamWorld Build as another pick, in case you want to load up on even more of the series. With season 2 of the Fallout TV show looming, now's the perfect time to explore the open-world RPGs that inspired the show with Fallout 3: Game of the Year Edition and Fallout New Vegas: Ultimate Edition. Both are available as part of the Best of Platinum Collection. These versions include the full base games plus every update, add-on, and DLC expansion. You can round out the selection with Fallout 76, which is an online multiplayer take on the series--though it still offers the same open-ended, first-person exploration and RPG gameplay as the other games. It also recently received a new Burning Springs DLC update that ties into the Amazon Prime Video streaming series. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Dragon Ball Super Complete Series Is 50% Off, Comes With 10 Steelbook Cases
description: Dragon Ball Super: Complete Series Steelbook Box Set (Blu-ray) $100 (was $200) See at Amazon Dragon Ball Z: Complete Series Box Set (Blu-ray) $119 (was $190) | Amazon Exclusive See at Amazon Dragon Ball Super: The Complete Series Collector's Edition is on sale for its lowest price ever at Amazon. Fans can get the Blu-ray box set featuring all 131 episodes of the anime for only $100 (was $200). The Collector's Edition comes with 10 steelbook cases and a decorative metal display box. Amazon's 50% discount eclipses the retailer's $120 Black Friday/Cyber Monday deal. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Arc Raiders Groundbreaking Quest Guide
description: The Groundbreaking quest in Arc Raiders takes place on the perpetually busy and dangerous Blue Gate map, and it has multiple objectives that send you to its northern region. If you're looking to find the locked room at Pilgrim's Peak, or need to know where to find the building pictured on the whiteboard, we'll fill you in on how to complete this quest here. You don't need to extract to complete Groundbreaking, but you'll receive the Blue Gate Communication Tower Key upon accepting this request, so you need to bring it into the raid with you. As such, you'll want to bring an augment with a safe pocket so that you don't accidentally lose this key during your journey to Pilgrim's Peak. If you do lose it, you'll have to wait to find another one (which is entirely random) or just hope you can catch the door open from someone else's key at some point. When you're ready to complete the Groundbreaking quest, read on. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Save Big On A 1,910-Piece Claw Machine Building Set That Actually Works
description: Pantasy Claw Machine Building Set (1,910 Pieces) $99 (was $140) | Limited-time deal See at Amazon Over the past five years, building-set manufacturer Pantasy has made a name for itself with impressive brick-built models. Pantasy's catalog includes officially licensed building sets based on Astro Boy, Garfield, The Little Prince, and Dragon Ball Z as well as a series of retro-inspired tech models. One of Pantasy's newest building sets might be its most ambitious: a working claw machine game. If that sounds cool to you, you have until 12 AM PT (December 17) to snag the 1,910-piece build for its lowest price yet. Normally $140 on Amazon and $150 on Pantasy's site, the Claw Machine is on sale for $99. Amazon's limited-time deal drops the price to $109, but you can save an additional $10 by clicking the coupon box on the store page. After reading about this extremely cool building set, you can check out our roundup of the best Pantasy building deals at the bottom of this story, including an officially licensed iGame Gaming Desktop for $64 (was $70), Sherlock Holmes' 3,000-plus piece apartment for $99.19 (was $130), a Retro Gumball Machine for $59.49 (was $80), and the Retro Desktop Computer for $75 (was $90). Pantasy Building Sets Save big on retro tech and architecture display models. See all deals at Amazon If you've only ever built Lego sets, it's worth noting Pantasy's bricks are fully compatible with Lego. This is common with non-Lego building sets, including Mega Bloks, Jazware's BLDR, and Brick Shop Hot Wheels cars. Continue Reading at GameSpot

description: Some who worked on the semi-autobiographical “Being Charlie” saw challenges play out on the set.
